item.title: A Nice and Satisfying Way to Look at Connections
item.description: Introduction It is difficult to find this rather nice way of looking at connections in differential geometry textbooks. Perhaps because it is not so much of use in Riemannian geometry (where your connection is basically always the Levi-Cività connection so in fact all the curvature is induced by the metric). But still, I think it’s nice and prepares the student for further study in geometry. In this article I’ll explain two Nice and Satisfying Things about this point of view.

item.title: Summer Research Project 2020
item.description: Over the summer I did a project in free boundary minimal annuli in the unit ball. Specifically, I studied an object called the critical catenoid, which is the only known example of a free boundary minimal annulus in the unit ball. I made a poster. This is an image I made of the critical catenoid with POV-Ray. I can’t seem to get the lighting or material just how I want it.
